A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Last Jedi tries so hard to tick every casting box that it forgot about plot or character development. Instead it feels like a bubble test where they skipped the first question: "tell a story" and now they've gotten a flat zero.

I didn't like the previous movies\, but they had their moments. I thought I would give the franchise one last shot. But this has turned me off it for good\, and I won't be wasting my time and money watching a movie that took it's inspiration from a combination of Chinese government propaganda and tumbler posts.

I can enjoy even the most poorly made movies\, so long as they are sci-fi\, but I found myself wanting to leave the theater halfway through this movie. This was a first for me\, but there was genuinely nothing enjoyable about this movie.


The pros:
There are light sabers.
Chewy shows up for a second.


The cons:
Characters are forgettable and make no sense
There is no plot
All Males are evil and all women are virtuous
Watching mold grow in the shower is more entertaining.
